comments: If p is an odd prime then a(p)=1. However, a(n) is also 1 for pseudoprimes to base 2 such as 341.
links: Harry J. Smith, Table of n, a(n) for n=1,...,1000
Index entries for sequences related to pseudoprimes
prog: (PARI) { for (n=1, 1000, write("b062173.txt", n, " ", 2^(n - 1)%n) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Aug 02 2009(Haskell)import Math.NumberTheory.Moduli (powerMod)a062173 n = powerMod 2 (n - 1) n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 17 2015
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jun 12 2001
